title: Honeytrapped on Facebook: Ordnance factory worker held for leaking secrets to Pak's ISI
content: An Ordnance Factory employee, Ravindra Kumar, was arrested by the Uttar Pradesh ATS for allegedly leaking classified defense information to a Pakistani intelligence handler posing as Neha Sharma. He shared sensitive documents via WhatsApp, endangering national security. Authorities continue to investigate the extent of the security breach.

title: 'Another round', screams drunk driver after killing woman in car rampage
content: A 23-year-old law student, Rakshit Chaurasia, allegedly in a drunken state, hit three vehicles, injuring eight and killing one in Vadodara. Chaurasia was driving while his friend Meet Chauhan owned the car. Chaurasia and Chauhan face charges, including culpable homicide. The deceased woman is identified as Hemali Patel, with her husband critically injured.

title: Blast at Pakistan mosque, Islamist leader among 4 hurt
content: A bomb explosion during Friday prayers at a South Waziristan mosque injured four, including JUI district chief Maulana Abdullah Nadeem. The blast occurred at Maulana Abdul Aziz Mosque, with an IED planted in the pulpit. Security officials are investigating the site, with no group claiming responsibility yet. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa mosques have been frequently targeted during Friday prayers.

title: 'Can field 2-3 teams at same time': DK credits IPL for revolutionising Indian cricket
content: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has credited the IPL with transforming Indian cricket by fostering a winning mentality and improving infrastructure. Karthik emphasised the depth of talent in Indian cricket, allowing the country to field multiple competitive teams simultaneously. He highlighted the confidence-building experiences IPL provides by allowing players to compete alongside global legends.

title: From daredevils to 'anti-nationals': Forest watchers face UAPA charges
content: Two forest watchers at Kanha National Park in Madhya Pradesh have been arrested under UAPA for allegedly aiding Maoists. Their detention has caused unrest among forest staff, leading to fears of being caught between insurgents and law enforcement. The arrests raise concerns about the infiltration of insurgents within wildlife sanctuaries, impacting both security and conservation efforts.

title: Infosys founder Narayana Murthy: Somehow it has become a fashion to ...
content: NR Narayana Murthy, co-founder of Infosys, emphasized at TiECon Mumbai that many so-called AI systems in India are merely traditional programming. He stressed the importance of genuine AI, which relies on machine learning and deep learning. Murthy acknowledged AI's potential for job displacement but highlighted its economic benefits.

title: 75+ Holi messages, greetings, wishes, and quotes
content: Holi 2025, the festival of colors, marks the arrival of spring and the triumph of good over evil. People globally exchange heartfelt messages, wishes, and greetings, spreading happiness and positivity among friends, family, and loved ones. Celebrate the spirit of togetherness with joy and vibrant colors.

title: 'Kamaal hai India ...': Anupam Mittal on Temasek's 10% stake in Haldiram
content: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal reacted to Temasek’s acquisition of a 9-10% stake in Haldiram's, valuing it at nearly $10 billion. This deal marks significant foreign investment in India's FMCG sector, with Temasek aiming to expand its footprint in the rapidly growing market.

title: 'Mistook us for dead': Pakistan train driver recalls 36-hour terror siege
content: The driver of Jaffar Express recounted the terror when BLA militants attacked the train, killing 21 civilians and 4 soldiers. The militants exploded a bomb under the engine, causing a derailment. The Pakistani military rescued 340 passengers after a two-day standoff, claiming 33 attackers were killed. The BLA disputed this, alleging they still hold hostages.

title: 'Boo me, but don't boo the team': David Warner
content: David Warner, set to debut in The Hundred with London Spirit, remains unfazed by potential boos from English fans. He relishes the challenge and excitement such reception brings. Though retired from international cricket, Warner remains critical of 'Bazball,' questioning its effectiveness in Australian conditions. Warner has often encountered a hostile reception in England, with tensions reaching a peak during the 2023 Ashes at Lord’s following Jonny Bairstow’s controversial stumping.

title: Metro expansions, new airport: Key takeaways from Tamil Nadu Budget
content: The Tamil Nadu government presented the 2025-26 budget with key welfare initiatives, including fare-free bus travel for women and monthly financial support. Amid the budget session, AIADMK protested over corruption allegations. Significant funds were allocated for housing, education, and new infrastructure projects.

title: Elon Musk claims Soros, Hoffman fund Tesla protests; Fortnite CEO agrees
content: Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney supports Elon Musk's claims that protests against Tesla are funded by billionaire donors, connecting it to Epic's battle with Big Tech. Sweeney criticizes deceptive funding of anti-Tesla campaigns and their violent fringes. Protests have intensified globally, reflecting dissatisfaction with Musk's political engagements, leading to notable incidents and public displays of disapproval.

title: Captain meets Captain! Harmanpreet, Hardik share MI's winning vibe - Watch
content: Mumbai Indians reached their second Women's Premier League final by defeating Gujarat Giants by 47 runs. The celebration featured both captains, Harmanpreet Kaur and Hardik Pandya, sharing a joyful moment. The win included standout performances from Nat Sciver-Brunt and Hayley Matthews. Mumbai Indians will now face Delhi Capitals in the title match.

title: Sana Khan slams trolls attacking her son and husband
content: Sana Khan has received hateful comments on social media about herself and her family, including her son. She addressed these trolls, criticizing the lack of education and civility in such remarks. Additionally, Sana faced backlash after a viral video showed her questioning Sambhavna Seth's attire, which was seen as imposing religious beliefs.

title: Day after wedding, woman strangled to death by family for marrying man she loved
content: A woman named Neha in Greater Noida was allegedly strangled to death by her father and brother for marrying someone from a different caste. They cremated her body swiftly. Neha's husband, Suraj, alerted the police after learning about her death. The father and brother were arrested following the confession. An FIR has been registered for murder.

title: 'Shami is a world-class player for a reason': Young Aussie rookie in awe of India pacer
content: Australia’s young all-rounder, Cooper Connolly, had a memorable ICC Champions Trophy semi-final debut against India. Despite an early dismissal by Mohammed Shami and dropping a catch, Connolly took Rohit Sharma's wicket, marking a significant achievement. Reflecting on the experience, he remains optimistic and eager to seize more opportunities at the international level.

title: Class 5 student guarding crop with dad mistaken for thief, shot dead
content: In Babupur village, UP's Shahjahanpur, a class 5 student was fatally shot by a villager, Veerpal, and his son, Akash, after they mistook him for a thief while he was guarding his family's crop field. The incident occurred as the boy delivered dinner to his father. Both accused have been arrested and charged with murder.

title: The inside story of two Australian woman kissing an Indian journalist on live TV
content: In 2015, journalist Vimal Kumar became part of an unexpected viral moment when two Australian women kissed him live on TV during a broadcast. Orchestrated by his photographer, the prank video has remained a popular clip on the internet. Kumar, a veteran sports reporter, continues to share insights through his YouTube channel.

title: Celebrities arrive at Ayan Mukerji’s home to pay their last respects to Deb Mukherjee
content: Veteran actor Deb Mukherjee passed away at 83 on March 14, 2025. Bollywood celebrities including Kajol, Jaya Bachchan, Ranbir Kapoor, and Alia Bhatt visited the Mukerji residence to offer their condolences. His funeral will be held at Pawan Hans Crematorium in Juhu. Mukherjee was known for his roles in 'Abhinetri' and 'Ek Baar Muskurado.'

title: 'Distilleries siphoned off funds’: ED claims Rs 1,000cr booze scam in Tamil Nadu
content: Distilleries in Tamil Nadu allegedly siphoned off Rs 1,000 crore in collaboration with bottle-making companies through inflated expenses and bogus purchases, as revealed by ED. The funds were paid to Tasmac officials as kickbacks to secure more supply orders and manipulate tenders, leading to high profits.

title: Man paraded naked, beaten up over affair in Gujarat
content: In Sabarkantha district, a man was abducted, beaten, and paraded naked by the husband and relatives of a woman he allegedly had an affair with. The incident occurred on March 11 in Chadasana village. The police have arrested seven people. The victim was forced to apologize in writing and his mobile was stolen.

title: Silent retreat, loud speculations: Is Kejriwal gearing up for Punjab elections?
content: Arvind Kejriwal’s Vipassana retreat in Punjab may signal a strategic shift for AAP, potentially involving party reshuffles ahead of the 2027 Punjab Assembly elections. While some speculate on internal meetings, AAP dismisses these as opposition rumors without substantiated development agendas.

title: Great-granddaughter of Mughal emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar is alive
content: Sultana Begum, the great-granddaughter-in-law of the last Mughal emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar, lives in a Kolkata slum in stark contrast to her royal heritage. She faces financial hardships, surviving on a meager pension, with little government support. Human rights activists have highlighted her plight, indicative of the neglect experienced by descendants of India's former aristocracy.

title: 'My identity was erased': How Telangana man ended up in Myanmar cybercrime den
content: Telangana police, led by the Cyber Security Bureau, have registered nine FIRs against agents involved in trafficking individuals into Myanmar's cybercrime hubs. The crackdown follows the return of 24 victims and focuses on deceptive recruitment and coercion tactics used via social media. Further cases and identifications are underway.

title: 'There was no doubt': Australia spinner after clearing bowling action test
content: Australian spinner Matthew Kuhnemann has been cleared to bowl after his action was questioned post-Sri Lanka tour. His 16-wicket haul led Australia to a 2-0 win. Kuhnemann was confident about his action and his experience. Despite missing one domestic game, he used the break to recover. Now, he's eyeing a spot on the West Indies tour.

title: POCSO case: Karnataka HC grants interim relief to former CM BS Yediyurappa
content: Karnataka High Court granted B.S. Yediyurappa interim relief by staying the summons in a POCSO Act case, requiring his appearance on March 15. The court emphasized a comprehensive investigation and quashing the charge sheet. Yediyurappa faces allegations of inappropriate touching and harassment but denies all charges, citing political motivations and readiness to face legal proceedings.

title: Watch: Video of New Zealand PM Christopher Luxon playing holi goes viral
content: A video of New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon celebrating Holi at ISKCON Auckland has resurfaced online. Luxon, set to visit India from March 16-20, aims to enhance trade and investment ties. He will meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, President Droupadi Murmu, and other leaders, emphasizing his admiration for India.

title: 'We'll see some get deported': What US VP said about green card holders
content: US Vice President JD Vance addressed key issues including the deportation of green card holders, immigration enforcement, and border security on 'The Ingraham Angle.' He discussed the administration's efforts to reduce illegal migration, strengthen the economy, and implement 'America first' trade policies. Vance also highlighted the administration's commitment to tackling national security threats posed by non-citizens.

title: Ranya Rao gold smuggling case: Accused Tarun Raju sent to 15-day judicial custody
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao was arrested for allegedly smuggling over 14 kg of gold after traveling to Dubai four times within 15 days. Her associate, Tarun Raju, was remanded to 15 days of judicial custody for his role in facilitating the purchase of the gold.

title: 3 dead after fire broke out at Rajkot's Atlantis building
content: A fire at the Atlantis Building in Rajkot, Gujarat, killed three people and injured one. Emergency services quickly responded and evacuated all residents. The fire has been controlled, and the injured person is receiving medical treatment. The names of the deceased have not yet been released, and further details are expected soon.

title: Chess Champion D Gukesh shaves head at Tirumala Temple- know tradition
content: Following his World Chess Championship victory, D Gukesh visits the Tirumala Temple in Andhra Pradesh, shaving his head to seek blessings. This traditional act signifies devotion and humility. Gukesh remains focused on upcoming tournaments in 2025, aiming for continuous improvement. His spiritual gesture has garnered appreciation online, with many praising his adherence to tradition.

title: Bihar cop dies as villagers attack police team, free arrested criminal
content: A Bihar assistant subinspector, Rajiv Ranjan Mall, died after a mob attacked a police team in Araria while they were apprehending notorious criminal Anmol Yadav at a wedding. Mall collapsed during the attack and was pronounced dead at the hospital. Six supporters of Anmol were arrested, but he remains untraced.

title: After ‘even God can’t fix Bengaluru traffic’ remark, DK rolls out solutions
content: Deputy CM DK Shivakumar has outlined an ambitious strategy to tackle Bengaluru's severe traffic congestion, including double-decker flyovers, tunnel roads, and elevated corridors. Key projects like the Peripheral Ring Road remain pending, while a substantial budget has been allocated for road improvements. Past infrastructural decisions are blamed for current woes, with new funding being secured to accelerate developments.

title: High-speed car kills 2 cops, civilian at police check post in Chandigarh
content: Two police officers and a civilian died when a speeding Volkswagen Polo crashed into them at a police check post in Chandigarh during Holi celebrations. The car driver and his friends were also injured, and liquor bottles were found in their vehicle. Senior police officials visited the scene to investigate.

title: Two Japanese tourists detained for taking ‘indecent’ photos at Great Wall of China
content: Two Japanese tourists were detained in China for two weeks for taking inappropriate photos at the Great Wall, with a man exposing his buttocks while a woman took pictures. After their detention, they were deported back to Japan, sparking outrage in China and leading to significant backlash on social media.

title: 'Allow agencies to intercept calls': Centre's conditions for India entry by Starlink
content: The Central Government has requested Starlink, Elon Musk's satellite venture, to establish a control centre in India. This measure will enable the suspension or shutdown of communications services in sensitive areas when needed to maintain law and order. Additionally, call interceptions by law enforcement agencies must be facilitated. Starlink is working with Reliance Jio and Airtel for network enhancements.

title: 'Don't remove my body': Tragic reasons behind award-winning farmer’s suicide
content: Young farmer awardee Kailash Arjun Nagare dies by suicide after consuming poison, citing government inaction on irrigation water demands. His death stirs massive unrest among local farmers, leading to protests and demands for accountability from the administration.

title: How broken Mercedes logo, CCTV tech helped crack Dehradun accident case
content: In Dehradun, police identified a hit-and-run vehicle by finding a broken Mercedes logo and using CCTV footage. The car, registered in Chandigarh, led them to nine potential matches. Further investigation and service records confirmed the culprit vehicle, ultimately tracing it back to the accused, Vansh Katyal, through his brother-in-law who owned the car.

title: Ranya Rao case: What blank ‘accused column’ in CBI FIR means for netas & babus
content: CBI has filed an FIR in Delhi regarding a gold-smuggling case allegedly involving actor Ranya Rao, without naming any specific individuals but identifying "unknown public servants" and "unknown private persons" as suspects. This step has intensified the investigation, potentially uncovering deep-rooted corruption within government circles.

title: Train collides with truck at closed level crossing in Maharashtra's Jalgaon
content: An Amravati-bound train collided with a truck illegally crossing closed railway tracks in Jalgaon, Maharashtra. No injuries were reported, but the collision disrupted the schedules of five trains, including the Mumbai-Amravati Express. The incident caused significant damage to railway infrastructure. Repair work is underway, and legal action may be taken against the truck driver.

title: Director Ayan Mukerji’s father, , veteran actor Deb Mukherjee, passes away
content: Veteran actor Deb Mukherjee, father of director Ayan Mukerji, passed away at 83. Known for films like 'Abhinetri' and 'Kaminey,' he had been hospitalized and died on March 14. Mukherjee's familial ties include actresses Kajol and Rani Mukerji. His contributions to Indian cinema and connection to Bollywood's Mukherjee-Samarth family are notable.

title: Axar Patel named Delhi Capitals captain for IPL 2025
content: Axar Patel has been named the new captain of Delhi Capitals for the upcoming IPL season. The experienced all-rounder, who has played 150 IPL matches, replaces Rishabh Pant. Delhi Capitals are the last team to announce their captain, with KL Rahul among the key players expected to support Axar’s leadership going into the 2025 season.

title: 'World knows where terror epicenter lies': India slams Pak’s train hijack allegation
content: India has strongly rejected Pakistan's allegations of involvement in the Balochistan train hijacking, pointing out Pakistan's issues with internal terrorism. Accusations emerged after the Balochistan Liberation Army seized the Jaffar Express, resulting in 58 deaths. Afghanistan also denied Pakistan's claims, urging Islamabad to address its own security challenges.

title: 'Have enough of our own ... ': Putin acknowledges Trump, PM Modi’s role in Ukraine talks
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin expressed gratitude to leaders including India's PM Modi and US President Trump for their efforts to end the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Putin agreed to a ceasefire if it leads to long-term peace, appreciating international support for peaceful resolution. PM Modi emphasized India's active role and reiterated the importance of negotiation over warfare.

title: Lawrence Super Bowl jab sparks spat with Parsons
content: DeMarcus Lawrence told a Seattle blogger that he was "not going to win a Super Bowl" in Dallas, a comment that led Cowboys star Micah Parsons to respond: "This what rejection and envy look like! This some clown s---!"

title: Curry hits 4,000 3s: 'Beyond my wildest dreams'
content: Stephen Curry became the first player to reach 4,000 career 3-pointers, extending his record to the milestone number during a win over the Kings.

title: Sources: George, doctors mulling star's injuries
content: 76ers forward Paul George is consulting with doctors this week on treatment options for his groin and knee injuries, including a possible procedure, sources told ESPN.

title: Darnold to apply lessons from disastrous '24 finish
content: New Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold is hoping to apply the lessons he learned from the disappointing end to his 2024 season, when he unraveled in two straight losses.

title: Texas' potential bid adds to 'historic' SEC season
content: Texas, the No. 13 seed in the SEC tournament which is on the bubble for the NCAA tournament, beat old foe Texas A&M in double overtime to reach the quarterfinals.

title: Former reality TV star wins longest-ever Iditarod
content: Jessie Holmes, a former reality television star on "Life Below Zero," is the winner of the longest-ever Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race.

title: UK's Oweh beats buzzer, burns ex-team OU again
content: Otega Oweh hit the winning shot against his former school again, sinking a baseline jumper with 0.5 left to lift Kentucky past Oklahoma 85-84 in the SEC tournament.

title: Star Texas golfer apologizes after heckling Rory
content: University of Texas golfer Luke Potter has apologized after he reportedly was removed from the grounds at TPC Sawgrass earlier this week for heckling star golfer Rory McIlroy.

title: Men's Bracketology: UNC's win pushes Xavier and Indiana to the brink
content: Indiana drops down to take the "first team out" spot as North Carolina bumps up after a win over Wake Forest on Thursday.

title: Cooper Flagg injury impact: Duke isn't 'Final Four good' without him, more reactions
content: How could Flagg's and Maliq Brown's potential absences impact the Blue Devils on the court -- and on Selection Sunday?

title: Ronald Acuna Jr. says he'll be more careful this season -- but no one believes him
content: From 40/70 to 40/30? The Braves' 2023 NL MVP is rehabbing with a plan to be stronger -- and healthier.

title: 'You don't hang banners for milestones': Tom Izzo adapts and takes aim at another title
content: Izzo is surpassing milestones and reached a big anniversary of his lone title. At 70, with a highly ranked team, he's hoping to add to his legacy.

title: Women's Bracketology: Stephen F. Austin seals spot, but all eyes on Ivy Madness
content: With the final two teams in the field facing off Friday, the center of the Bracketology universe is Providence, Rhode Island.

title: From a South Carolina repeat to UConn ending its title drought: Six teams that could win it all
content: Sixty-eight teams will compete in  March Madness. But these six make up the short list of title contenders.

title: Making sense of QB moves in free agency: We ranked the 10 best fits and answered big questions
content: Sam Darnold to Seattle. Geno Smith to Las Vegas. Aaron Rodgers to ...? Our experts sort through quarterback signings, trades and extensions.

title: Inside the Sabres' never-ending rebuild -- and how they get back to the playoffs
content: From Ryan O'Reilly to Jack Eichel to Sam Reinhart and more, success follows for a player once he leaves, with Buffalo set to miss the playoffs again.

title: Rashford, MLS in Tuchel's first England squad
content: Thomas Tuchel has handed Marcus Rashford a shock recall in his first England squad, which also includes call-ups for Myles Lewis-Skelly, Dominic Solanke and Dan Burn.

title: Bruno hits back at Ratcliffe's 'overpaid' comments
content: Bruno Fernandes has hit back at Sir Jim Ratcliffe's suggestion that some Manchester United players are overpaid by telling the British billionaire "the club agrees to do the contracts."

title: Prince William: PL 3 p.m blackout is 'irritating'
content: Prince William has said he finds the 3 p.m blackout rule "irritating" and is a hindrance to his Aston Villa fandom.

title: Alexander-Arnold to miss Carabao Cup final
content: Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold is set to miss this weekend's Carabao Cup final against Newcastle United through injury.

title: Super Cup probe: Judge questions Gerard Piqué
content: Former Barcelona defender Gerard Piqué is being questioned by a judge on Friday as part of judicial probe into the business deal that led to the Spanish Super Cup being hosted in Saudi Arabia.

title: Real Madrid's Asencio earns first Spain call-up
content: Spain coach Luis de la Fuente has included Real Madrid defender Raúl Asencio in the squad for the first time for the Nations League quarterfinal tie against the Netherlands in a squad that also includes Barcelona forward Lamine Yamal.

title: Messi scores on return as Miami wins in Jamaica
content: Lionel Messi scored on his return to action as Inter Miami triumphed 2-0 in Jamaica over Cavalier FC on Thursday to qualify for the quarterfinals of the Concacaf Champions Cup.

title: Eddie Howe: 'Chance to make history' in cup final
content: Eddie Howe has said Newcastle United have the chance to make history by beating Liverpool in the Carabao Cup final on Sunday.

title: 75 years of innovation: How F1 has evolved since 1950 and where it's headed
content: To celebrate F1's 75th anniversary, ESPN charts the sport's evolution since 1950 through its most iconic cars, and details where it's headed in 2026.

title: If Hamilton is in F1 title fight, Leclerc expects to be, too
content: Lewis Hamilton's move to Ferrari has dominated headlines, but teammate Charles Leclerc is ready for a big year.

title: Dick Vitale hands out the only postseason awards that matter
content: With Cooper Flagg mentions galore, here are the best players of the 2024-25 men's college hoops season, according to Dick Vitale.

title: Watkins, Bueckers, Hidalgo headline All-America team -- but who's player of the year?
content: Our experts name their women's college basketball player of the year, All-Americans and biggest surprise.

title: Team-by-team preview: Can Orlando Pride repeat as champions?
content: With the National Women's Soccer League returning to action this weekend, we take a look at where the 14 clubs stands and how close each is to winning the NWSL championship.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea beat Man United to Quenda deal
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal to sign Sporting CP wing-back Geovany Quenda from under the noses of Man United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: Every way to bet on Alex Ovechkin's goals record chase
content: Alex Ovechkin is one of the hottest NHL bets, here are the special markets bettors can bet on as he closes in on the goals scored record.

title: Betting buzz: Steelers attract second-most Super Bowl bets this week
content: Bettors were on the Pittsburgh Steelers' Super Bowl odds after the acquisition of wide receiver DK Metcalf

title: UFC expert picks, best bets: How Vettori can win in return from layoff
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: PFL 2025: What are the fights and potential matchups to look forward to?
content: The new season of PFL brings new fighters and new weight classes. Here are the best matchups and the reason why you should watch.

title: Can Saskatchewan clinch a playoff spot? What to watch in NLL Week 16 and beyond
content: Get caught up on all the key intel before the games on the docket this weekend, all available to stream on ESPN+.

title: 'Hold that rock up, baby': DK Metcalf reveals engagement to Normani
content: The couple began dating in 2022 after being introduced by R&B singer Ciara, who is married to Metcalf's former Seahawks teammate Russell Wilson.

title: Paddy procurement woes continue in Kuttanad
content: Paddy procurement in Kuttanad faces hiccups due to quality issues, discounts demanded by agents, and delays in harvesting.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Man in Nizamabad Cyber Crime police custody dies, case registered
content: He complained of chest pain around 10 pm and taken to local government hospital where he collapsed, said Nizamabad ACP

title: A trans woman’s journey in revival of helpdesk at Gachibowli police station
content: Since its relaunch, over 40 transgender individuals rescued from prostitution rackets have already been counselled.

title: Gold smuggling case: Hotelier remanded to 15 days' judicial custody
content: Tarun Raju, allegedly an accomplice in the case involving actor Ranya Rao was arrested on Wednesday by the DRI

title: Former Chief Justice discusses Periyar, Savarkar ideologies
content: Political actors stoop and exploit religious sentiments blurring lines between faith and electoral strategy, says A.P. Shah, retired Chief Justice of Madras High Court

title: Majestic No More: In the heart of Bengaluru, reminder of a bygone era
content: As the Karnataka Budget for 2025-26 announced plans for the redevelopment of the Kempegowda Bus Station at Majestic, The Hindu, in a six-part series, will explore the various facets of the pete area.

title: T.N. Budget 2025: Chennai to get its sixth reservoir between Kelambakkam and Mamallapuram
content: The reservoir would be created at a cost of ₹350 crore in the Kovalam sub basin, Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu said

title: Hurriyat chief Mirwaiz Umar Farooq placed under house arrest; barred from congregational Friday prayers
content: The Hurriyat chief was scheduled to visit Jamia Masjid in Nowhatta locality to offer the congregational prayers. He delivers a speech at the historic mosque on Fridays

title: Outstanding Debt to GSDP ratio of T.N. projected at 26.07% in 2025-26: Thangam Thennarasu
content: The State has emerged as a leader in electronics and electric vehicle (EV) manufacturing, attracting major investments, says Thangam Thennarasu

title: Not much work done on integrated township project in KGF: Minister
content: Industries would be developed on 700 acres and an integrated township, including housing and other facilities, would be created on 300 acres

title: Yellow heatwave alert to multiple districts in Telangana on Friday and Saturday
content: The districts of Adilabad, Jagtial, Kumaram Bheem Asifabad, and Mancherial are expected to experience temperatures ranging between 41°C and 44°C on Friday

title: Assam | Will the remote state be India’s next big travel destination?
content: Once a remote and overlooked corner of India, the state is now in the global spotlight. With a tourism boom underway, it is on track to becoming the country’s next big travel destination

title: T.N. Budget 2025: Govt. to submit DPRs of 3 Chennai Metro Rail projects to Union govt. for equity contribution
content: DPRs for the Avinashi Road-Sathyamangalam Road Metro Rail corridor in Coimbatore and the Thirumangalam-Othakadai Metro Rail corridor in Madurai will also be submitted to the Union government, the FM said

title: Putin thanks Modi, Trump for 'noble mission' to resolve Ukraine conflict
content: Since the Ukraine conflict began, Prime Minister Modi has spoken to Russia’s Vladimir Putin as well as Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelensky a number of times.

title: Woman killed, four injured as law student rams car into two-wheelers in Gujarat’s Vadodara
content: It could be a case of drunk driving as eyewitnesses, who caught Chaurasiya at the scene, told the police that he appeared intoxicated and was screaming “another round, another round” after coming out of the car

title: ‘ED has ulterior motives’: Senthilbalaji denies financial irregularities in Tasmac
content: The ED had said it had uncovered serious financial fraud involving distillery companies and bottling entities through the generation of unaccounted-for cash and illicit payments

title: Local ticket to Manipur | In Guwahati, Manipuri Rice Hotels are testaments to stories of community and food
content: Much like Kolkata’s Chinatown and Dharamshala’s Little Tibet, Guwahati’s Manipuri Basti is a microcosm of the people and their culture. And nowhere is it more pronounced than in its rice hotels

title: Madras High Court confirms conviction, one-year sentence imposed on M.H. Jawahirullah
content: Justice P. Velmurugan, however, directs the CBI not to execute the trial court verdict for a period of 30 days since the month of Ramzan is ongoing

title: T.N. Budget 2025: Registration fee reduced by 1% for immovable assets under women’s name
content: The Minister also announced a major initiative to elevate one lakh women as entrepreneurs with the aim of further increasing women’s participation in the State’s economic development

title: ‘Appu’ re-release: How an anti-hero film propelled the rise of Puneeth Rajkumar in Kannada cinema
content: Puri Jagannadh’s ‘Appu’, a blockbuster that catapulted its debut hero Puneeth Rajkumar to stardom, is now back on the big screen, as a tribute to the late star who had a magnetic appeal among family audiences

title: Woman found dead with throat slit at Parassala in Kerala capital
content: The deceased, a doctor, was allegedly found lying in a pool of blood in bathroom by her husband around 1 a.m.

title: T.N. Budget 2025: Earned leave surrender system restored for govt. employees
content: Finance Minister Thangam Thennarsu told the Assembly that the EL surrender system was suspended due to the severe financial strain in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic

title: Tushar Gandhi says ‘will not apologise’ for his remarks on RSS
content: ‘They want me to apologise for what I said. They want me to retract my statement. I do not do that. I do not believe in retracting it or even apologising for making the statement’, says Tushar Gandhi

title: Mehbooba says 'bigots' have converted Holi celebrations into source of fear for minorities
content: The PDP chief had said pitting Hindus and Muslims against each other will have "dangerous consequences" for the country.

title: T.N. Budget 2025: Dhanushkodi to be declared as Greater Flamingo Sanctuary, ₹50-crore foundation to be set up for marine conservation
content: Presenting the Budget 2025-26, the Finance Minister said the sanctuary will help safeguard wetland birds and protect the diverse ecosystems of sand dunes, marshes, and mangrove forests

title: T.N. Budget 2025: Govt. to establish science centre in Chennai, 10 new arts and science colleges
content: Presenting the State Budget 2025-26, Mr. Thennarasu said the centre will feature true-to-life miniature models covering STEM fields, along with exhibits on space and astronomy

title: Chander Kunj Army Towers in Kochi safe to be demolished, may take about 10 months, says expert team
content: Kerala High Court has ordered the demolition and reconstruction of towers B and C of Chander Kunj Army Towers developed by Army Welfare Housing Organisation citing serious structural problems

title: T.N. Budget 2025: Govt. to launch Semiconductor Mission 2030, knowledge corridor in Hosur
content: Tamil Nadu Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu said a ‘Semiconductor Fabless Lab’ would be established in Chennai at an estimated cost of ₹100 crore in collaboration with leading industry and academic institutions

title: Tamil Nadu Budget: T.N. announces new airport in Rameswaram, to speed up Parandur airport work
content: Presenting the 2025-26 Budget, the Finance Minister announced the Tamil Nadu Maritime Transport Manufacturing Policy 2025 to revive the State’s maritime heritage and position Tamil Nadu as a global shipbuilding hub

title: Rescue Op in Telangana tunnel day 21: Teams use liquid ring vacuum pump to expedite silt removal in SLBC tunnel
content: The rescue teams also planned to scan the area up to 50 meters from the end rock with the help of ground probing radar (GPR) to trace the seven people

title: A.P. Minister Nara Lokesh participates in Mangalagiri temple Kalyana Mahotsavam
content: The Kalyana Mahotsavam (celestial wedding) of Sri Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy is part of the temple’s annual Brahmotsavam celebrations.

title: T.N. allocated funds for Samagra Shiksha from its own resources to compensate for dues from Centre: Thangam Thennarasu
content: Presenting the Budget 2025-26, Mr. Thennarasu said the Union government has withheld the approved amount of ₹2,152 crore citing the State’s non-acceptance of the NEP 2020, which includes the three-language policy

title: ED attaches assets worth ₹1.90 lakh in Hyderabad human trafficking rackets operated by Bangladeshi nationals
content: The victims were lured into India by agents who promised them well-paying jobs in beauty parlours, tailor shops, steel factories, and as domestic workers

title: Central agencies being used to subdue political opponents: CPI(M) MP Radhakrishnan
content: The ED has summoned the Alathur MP for questioning in a money laundering case linked to alleged irregularities in Karuvannur Service Cooperative Bank

title: Tamil Nadu Budget 2025-26: Transpersons to be inducted into Home Guard force
content: The Finance Minister said the government planned to establish three hostels for girl students with modern facilities in Chennai, Coimbatore, and Madurai

title: Man impersonating Oman High Commissioner arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad
content: A Mercedes car, one identity card and 46 visiting cards were recovered from his possession at the time of his arrest from Uttar Pradesh Gate in Ghaziabad

title: T.N. budget gives priority to archaeological excavations, new museums, and Indus Valley Cultural Gallery
content: Thangam Thennarau said the journey in search of the cultural identities of ancient Tamils had also expanded to regions in the neighbouring States: Palur (Odisha), Vengi (Andhra Pradesh), and Maski (Karnataka)

title: T.N. Budget 2025: One lakh new houses in rural areas under Kalaignar Kanavu Illam scheme
content: Presenting the Budget in the Assembly, the Finance Minister said 25,000 houses that could not be renovated would be reconstructed at cost of ₹600 crore

title: T.N. Budget announces development of ‘Global City’ near Chennai
content: The work for the first phase of the ‘Global City’ project, offering world-class facilities, will be taken up by TIDCO soon, Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu said

title: Four militants arrested in separate operations in Manipur
content: One of them was a member of the proscribed United National Liberation Front who was arrested from near the India-Myanmar border in Tenugopal district in Manipur

title: T.N. Budget 2025-26: Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu announces archaeological excavation at eight locations
content: The Tamil Nadu Finance Minister said ‘Noyyal Museum’ would be set up in Erode district at a cost of ₹24 crore and ‘Navai Museum’ in Ramanathapuarm district at a cost of ₹21 crore

title: Parliamentary panel recommends hike in wage rates under MGNREGA
content: The panel expressed disappointment that despite its multiple recommendations on this matter over the years, the government has not implemented any significant changes.

title: AIADMK, BJP legislators stage walkout as Finance Minister begins Budget speech in T.N. Assembly
content: Edappadi K. Palaniswami said the Enforcement Directorate searches in Tasmac had found irregularities to the tune of ₹1,000 crore and demanded the resignation of the DMK government

title: India denies Pakistan’s ‘baseless’ allegations of India’s involvement in acts of terrorism
content: In the particular attack on Jaffar Express, the terrorists had been in contact with their handlers and ringleaders in Afghanistan, Foreign Office spokesperson Shafqat Ali Khan said

title: The story behind the Rupee symbol: how it came into existence?
content: After extensive research, Udaya Kumar Dharmalingam combined the Devanagari ‘Ra’ for rupiah and the Roman ‘R’ for rupees to create the rupee (₹) symbol, giving it a distinctly Indian yet universal identity

title: Siddaramaiah writes to T.N. CM Stalin, requests D.K. Shivakumar to attend anti-delimitation meeting
content: Karnataka CM supports DMK-led opposition against delimitation, sends Deputy to Chennai meeting with Tamil Nadu CM Stalin

title: In Karnataka, efforts on to combat the challenge of a hidden disability in newborns: hearing impairment
content: With the launch of the Newborn Hearing Screening programme by the Mysuru-based All India Institute of Speech and Hearing placing emphasis on early identification of hearing loss in newborns, nearly 6,000 are screened almost every month to detect hearing loss issues among the infants

title: Campaign against drugs: Battle for Andhra’s future
content: The government is planning to launch an aggressive campaign in schools and colleges to curb the menace of substance abuse; anti-drug clubs on all campuses and an army of mental health counsellors will spearhead the initiative, writes P. Sujatha Varma

title: Kolkata’s Jadavpur University loses Institute of Eminence status
content: It comes as the university remains embroiled in protests amidst rising demands for a student union election

title: The price of pet care in Hyderabad
content: Pet healthcare in Hyderabad is split between affordable but limited government hospitals and costly private clinics offering advanced care. The industry also suffers from weak regulation, inflated pricing and inconsistent veterinary expertise. Siddharth Kumar Singh explores the need for expanded government services, standardised pricing and stricter oversight to bridge this gap and make pet care more accessible

title: How can India meet its rising power demand?
content: Besides economic growth and urbanisation, climate change-induced heat stress is one of the key factors driving electricity demand. Episodes of power shortages in the last two years amid rapid growth in demand pose an important question. How should India act and plan to meet its rising energy demand reliably and cost-effectively?

title: Ranya Rao gold smuggling case: CBI probing ‘role’ of public servants
content: This was based on the inputs shared by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI), which recently arrested Kannada actor Ranya Rao allegedly with smuggled gold.

title: Once a shopping hub, traders in Majestic now hardly see customers
content: As the Karnataka Budget for 2025-26 announced plans for the redevelopment of the Kempegowda Bus Station at Majestic, The Hindu, in a six-part series, will explore the various facets of the pete area. This is the fifth story in the series.

title: Tamil Nadu Budget 2025 LIVE: Registration fee reduction for women property holders, induction of transpersons in Home Guards announced
content: Tamil Nadu’s Budget focuses on Tamil language, infrastructure and education in the last full-fledged Budget before Assembly election in 2026

title: BRS member G. Jagadish Reddy suspended for remainder of Assembly session
content: House adopts motion against the member for “making insulting remarks, derogatory comments against the Speaker”

title: Bengaluru’s AVGC-XR sector goes pale as 110-year-old Technicolor closes shop
content: As many as 3,000 of Technicolor employees lost jobs in Bengaluru recently. The company was the global face of the State’s AVGC-XR, a sector Karnataka has been ambitiously trying to scale up, reports Mini Tejaswi

title: Adopt innovative measures to counter security challenges: Air Chief Marshal A.P. Singh
content: Air Chief Marshal A.P. Singh draws attention towards the hybrid nature of future warfare where the conflict is likely to be spread across multiple domains

title: Karimnagar-based film critic Ponnam Ravichandra to serve as jury member for IFFS Don Quixote Award for Feature Films
content: Karimnagar film critic Ponnam Ravichandra selected as jury member for IFFS Don Quixote Award; NIFF in Kathmandu 2025

title: No longer just a problem of the elderly, kidney disease is affecting young Indians too, say experts
content: Maintaining an ideal body weight, consuming a balanced diet and ensuring six to eight hours of sleep are all crucial steps towards ensuring kidney health; despite the increasing prevalence of kidney issues among young Indians, awareness remains low, say doctors

title: Haryana civic polls: Congress put up a half-hearted fight, BJP went all out
content: In the results declared on March 12, the BJP came out on top, winning mayoral elections in nine out of 10 municipal corporations.

title: What will be India's approach to trade talks with US?
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Ex-Cong MLA Bamber Thakur shot at in Chhattisgarh
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Raising the rusty dust of red soil
content: Residents from six villages of Sindhudurg district in Maharashtra oppose iron ore mining projects entering their lands. Purnima Sah reports on their fear of losing natural resources, livelihoods, and their health, much like Redi, their neighbouring village

title: On Camera, Drunk Driver Kills Woman In Vadodara, Screams "Another Round"
content: A road accident in the Karelibag area of Gujarat's Vadodara has left one dead and several others injured after an allegedly drunk driver crashed his car into multiple vehicles late on Thursday night.

title: "As Soon As Train Stopped...": Hijacked Pak Train Driver Recalls Executions
content: Some hostages crouched on the floor for as long as 27 hours, remaining motionless, while some could only gasp in shock as armed rebels entered the train and began executing passengers.

title: UP Man, Lured By Pak Agent 'Neha', Arrested For Leaking Defence Info
content: Uttar Pradesh's Anti-Terrorism Squad has arrested a man working in an ordnance factory in Firozabad on suspicion of spying for Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence, or ISI.

title: Chennai Doctor Who Died By Suicide With Family Suffered Rs 5-Crore Loss
content: A doctor in Chennai, who died by suicide with his wife and their two teenage sons at their home on Thursday, had suffered financial losses amounting to Rs 5 crore.

title: Sudan, Somalia Or Somaliland? US, Israel Turn To Africa For Gaza Relocation
content: The US and Israel have reached out to officials of three East African governments to discuss using their territories as potential destinations for resettling Palestinians uprooted from the Gaza Strip under Donald Trump's proposed postwar plan.

title: How Broken Mercedes Parts Helped Cops Trace Dehradun Hit-And-Run Suspect
content: Dehradun Police used camera footage and broken car parts to track down the luxury SUV that was involved in a deadly hit-and-run incident in the city on Wednesday.

title: "A Green Card Holder Doesn't...": JD Vance Triggers New Immigration Debate
content: After US President Donald Trump's proposed 'gold card' initiative, which would create a new immigration pathway for wealthy foreigners, Vice President JD Vance's latest remarks on the rights of green card holders have triggered a fresh debate.

title: Rupee Symbol, Replaced By Tamil Nadu, Was Designed By A Tamilian
content: D Udaya Kumar, currently working as a professor at IIT Guwahati, designed the Indian rupee symbol in 2010.

title: Bumrah Shocker For MI In IPL, Due To 'Stress Injury' Star Set To Miss...
content: Jasprit Bumrah, who took the Player of the Series award in Australia for his 32 scalps, was subsequently ruled out of Indias Champions Trophy winning campaign

title: US Influencer Leaves Australia After Outrage Over Baby Wombat Video
content: In a now-deleted video, Sam Jones, an American influencer, was seen grabbing a baby wombat and carrying it away from his mother.

title: Brigadier Faces Case After Colonel's Wife Alleges Sex Abuse In Shillong
content: An Army Brigadier has been accused of sexual harassment by a junior officer's wife in Meghalaya capital Shillong. Meghalaya Police have registered a case, but no arrest has been made yet. An official response from the Indian Army is awaited.

title: 'Due To Hindi Row, Delimitation...': Tamil Minister On Liquor Corruption Claims
content: Tamil Nadu Excise Minister Senthil Balaji on Friday strongly denied Enforcement Directorate claims of a possible fraud of Rs 1,000 crore in operations of the TASMAC, the state-run liquor sales agency.

title: Train Collides With Truck At Closed Level Crossing, All Passengers Safe
content: The crash reportedly damaged the railway infrastructure, including overhead electric wires. This disrupted the railway traffic briefly, which was restored around 8:50 am.

title: Innova Driver Loses Control, Rams Lorry, Then Hits Biker. 5 Injured
content: According to the Sub Inspector of Hanumakonda police station, a case has been registered in connection with the accident.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Liverpool's Slot looks to follow Klopp, Newcastle chase history
content: arne slot's side are 15 points clear at the top of the table with nine games left to play . the reds are closing on what would be only a second league title since 1990 . a penalty shootout win over liverpool puts the club 15 points ahead of the quarterfinals .

title: No 'trust the process'? What's next for the Phoenix Suns
content: Kevin Durant helps the Suns erase a 23-point deficit en route to defeating the Clippers . the suns had given up 41 points in the second quarter and trailed by 19 entering the fourth . Durant later downplayed his first-quarter sideline clash with coach Mike Budenholzer .

title: After PSG beat Liverpool, we ask: Is Dembélé the world's best?
content: ale Moreno says the departure of Kylian Mbappe has enabled Luis Enrique to turn PSG into a stronger team overall . he was an 18-year-old playing for Rennes and was on his way to scoring 12 goals and assisting five more in fewer than 2,000 minutes . "you also score with your right foot?" he asked .

title: Power Rankings: Capitals back at No. 1, plus each team's playoff scoring leaders
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday, which generates our master list . the top career playoff scorers for each of the league's teams are ranked by the NHL's official records site .

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: free agency kicked off with the legal negotiation window on Monday . players can now officially sign with new teams as of Wednesday . the 49ers are interested in Mac Jones, dating back to the 2021 draft . a number of players have already signed with the new league year .

title: ‘He was getting buckets’: Cooper Flagg always seemed inevitable
content: Cooper Flagg suffered a left ankle injury late in the first half of Duke's ACC Tournament quarterfinal game against Georgia Tech . the flag is pinned to the siding above the front door of Nemer's home alongside Sebasticook Lake . his facebook page is a shrine to Flagg, an endless scroll of highlights, stats and overt gushing that might seem like hyperbole if directed at anyone other than college basketball's biggest star .

title: What do the first two rounds of a perfect draft look like?
content: fantasy baseball managers all over the world are getting ready for those ever-crucial drafts . they say practice makes perfect -- and you can certainly practice your drafting skills in our Mock Draft Lobby . Tristan H. Cockcroft and Eric Karabell weighed in on each of their ideal picks from each of the 10 draft positions in an ESPN standard league .

title: Denzel Washington speaks to Colorado football
content: the Colorado Buffaloes received words of wisdom from legendary actor and director Denzel Washington . "when you pray for rain, you got to deal with the mud too," he says to start off the video clip . a bold request for the team to invite him to the national championship game when it reaches it . it's a no-brainer the Giants should select him no. 3 overall .

title: How Chelsea Gray and Angel Reese powered the Rose to the semifinals
content: the last five seconds of the first half of unrivaled's final regular-season game between Rose BC and Vinyl counted down . the rose is called Point Gawd for a reason  10 points, 4 rebounds, and 4 assists at half pic.twitter.com/Mnu78ntRL1 .
